alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 21 at 2:20AM MST until February 23 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches. West winds gusting as high as 60 mph through Tuesday afternoon. Then, east-northeast winds gusting up to 40 to 50 mph at times Tuesday night through Wednesday night. * WHERE...Ferris/Seminoe/Shirley Mountains, Shirley Basin, Central Carbon County and North Snowy Range Foothills. This includes the cities of Rawlins and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could produce whiteout conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in 10 minutes or less.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin
